title: Secured Connection Failed Error - Unable to open link in emails and messages
content: After a recent regular automatic update I am unable to open most links I have regularly used for years in messages, emails, etc. in FireFox but can open with Google. Get message "an error occurred during a connection to dl-mail.ymail.com. SSL received a record that exceeded the maximum permissible length. Error code: SSL_error_rx_record_to_ long." Also "error occurred during a nonnection to identity.tylerportico.com. PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR". Unable to diagnose or correct issue. Has anyone else experienced this problem? Would appreciate help.

title: Website Functionality completely broken after using "recent activity" function to open them
content:
After using the "recent browsing" menu in the top left corner of FF and opening certain websites from the "import tabs from other devices" menu it has completely broken a handful of websites on my PC entirely, even using other browsers.

The page will load but no content is displayed, no links or media, just a blank white page. This is consistent among these websites even among other browsers including Chrome and Edge.

I have uninstalled and reinstalled FF multiple times, cleared cache/history, hard PC resets, refreshed FF, Uninstalled and reinstalled every browser. The issue persists.

These websites still function perfectly fine on mobile FF and Chrome. I've exhausted website permissions, app permissions, etc. The issue still persists. These websites were functioning just minutes before I tried importing them from the other devices tabs. Something about that functionality has completely broken them on my PC.

title: Error code when trying to log in to Yahoo email accts
content:
Up until 2 days ago, I had no issues accessing my yahoo email accounts (sbcglobal.net through At&T) I had done nothing different re settings. I rebooted my modem and my computer several times. I deleted old history which I do several times a week anyway. I called AT&T support team but they just suggested logging on to another browser. So I tried Edge and was able to access the emails successfully. I even "refreshed" Firefox and nothing changed except I had to replace several quick links. I checked for updates and discovered my Firefox browser is up to date. My Android cell phone has no issues with the emails. I have one on Firefox browser and one with Chrome on my cell phone and no issues with either one. I have been using the same log in link for many years. I even explored the new way to log in called "Currently.com" for yahoo mail. Still won't work on Firefox. But it does work on Edge. I would prefer to continue using Firefox for browser but need to use Edge til I figure this out. Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated. (BTW wifi IS on and the connection for everything else works fine.

Here is the message I get when I try to log in: "Something's gone wrong We may be having trouble with your connection. Connecting your device to Wi-Fi could help fix the issue or try again later. If you were using an app, close this page. Otherwise, start over." Legal policy center Privacy policy Terms of use Accessibility Your privacy choices Â©2025 AT&T Intellectual Property. All rights reserved.

content: The main sign on to AT&T is not working from the main screen. I've cleared history cookies, saved sign on and everything else. title: Video Flickering and Lag in Firefox
content:
Hi everyone,

About a month ago, I began experiencing issues with video playback. When I visit websites with videos (such as YouTube, news sites, etc), the videos often start flickering, as shown in the screenshot. This flickering is accompanied by significant lag, which only stops if I scroll away from the video or navigate off the page.

Iâve noticed that disabling hardware acceleration in Firefox fixes the flickering issue, but it introduces bad screen tearing, which is also annoying. Iâd prefer to keep hardware acceleration enabled to avoid tearing, but the flickering and lag make it unusable in its current state.

Has anyone else encountered this issue? If so, are there any known fixes or settings I can adjust to resolve the flickering while keeping hardware acceleration enabled?

Hereâs what Iâve tried so far:

Updated Firefox to the latest version.

Updated my graphics drivers.

Cleared cache and cookies.
creator: twinklover
